content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Sure, here is an example of how you could write the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    # Split the input string into an array of words
    words = split(text)

    # Initialize an empty string to hold the wrapped text
    wrapped_text = ""

    # Initialize a counter for the current line's length
    line_length = 0

    # Iterate over the words
    for word in words
        # If adding the word to the current line would exceed the maximum width,
        # add a newline character to the wrapped text and reset the line length
        if line_length + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
            line_length = 0
        end

        # Add the word and a space to the wrapped text
        wrapped_text *= word * " "
        line_length += length(word) + 1
